alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 5:07PM MDT until August 25 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL GARFIELD COUNTY... At 507 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated 1 to 1.5 inches of rain fell across the headwaters of Alvey Wash. Rainfall has tapered off, however flash flooding is likely ongoing through Alvey Wash. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, slot canyons, dry washes, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include Alvey Wash, Bighorn Canyon, Tunnel Slot Canyon, Harris Wash. Flows along Alvey Wash will impact portions of Escalante. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
